Medical tattooing Cape Town: restore your appearance

You’re tired of hiding your scars or thinning hair and you want to feel confident again. You’ve tried using makeup, but it never worked for you!

Imagine getting rid of the embarrassing scars on your face, restoring your missing nipple from cancer or restoring thinning hair from alopecia. Now imagine being able to go out in public without feeling self-conscious about how people are looking at you because they can’t see any more evidence of those old injuries or surgeries.

Medical micro pigmentation is an innovative technique used to restore the original colour by “tattooing” an area of skin with single-use sterile pigments, well tolerated by the body, which are offered in a wide range of shades for our client’s well-being.
Book Your procedure

What is medical tattooing and how does it work?

Medical tattooing, also known as micro pigmentation, is a form of tattooing that uses sterile needles and pigments to fill in scars, restore colour to areas of the skin, or create the appearance of hair. The pigments used in medical tattooing are made from minerals and are safe for use on the skin.

Medical tattooing uses a single-use needle to inject sterile pigment under the skin’s dermis layer. The process is virtually painless, as numbing topical anaesthetic can be applied to the skin beforehand.

A month after the first tattooing session, a second procedure is needed to fine-tune the results and colour. Patients can use a calming cream for several days post-procedure to minimize irritation. To ensure optimal healing, it’s essential to keep the area clean and dry and to avoid using makeup or other products on the tattooed area for at least a week.

This permanent makeup technique is often used to:

  • Fade the appearance of scars

  • Restore the colour of areolas following breast surgery

  • Create the appearance of fuller eyebrows

  • Mimic the appearance of hair to cover bolding spots

Book Your procedure

The benefits of medical tattooing

  • Improve the appearance of scars.
  • Restore colour to the skin after surgery or injury
  • Create the appearance of hair on the scalp
  • A safe and effective way to improve the appearance of the skin
  • A minimally invasive procedure with minimal side effects
Book Your procedure

How Does the Medical Tattooing Procedure Work at Blink Beauty Salons?

Before Treatment

In your initial consultation, you will work closely with your medical tattoo artist to plan your custom tattoo. They will help you choose the right pigments, design, and placement for your desired results. During your consultation, you will also have the opportunity to ask any questions that you may have about the procedure.

During Treatment

Your medical tattooing will be done in Blink Beauty Salon. To begin, the artist will review your tattoo’s details with you and finalize any remaining details. Next, a topical anaesthetic is applied to reduce discomfort during the procedure. The makeup artist will then artfully apply the custom-colored pigments to provide the results you want for your cosmetic problems.

After Treatment

Once the tattooing is finished, the medical artist will take care of dressing the area with a sterile dressing. They will also provide aftercare instructions to help you heal quickly and avoid infection. After your medical tattooing, keeping the area clean and dry is important. You should also avoid sun exposure and wear sunscreen when outside.

Book Your procedure

Medical tattooing before and after

Book Your procedure

Why Choose Blink Beauty for Your Medical Tattooing Treatment?

It’s not about the destination; it’s about the journey. Why would people want to come and experience our brand?

Our highly trained and experienced medical tattoo artists are dedicated to providing you with the best possible results. We use only the highest quality pigments and equipment to ensure that your tattoo looks natural and lasts for years.

Letting a trained and certified professional handle your medical tattooing needs is the best way to ensure you get the desired results.

At Blink Beauty Salons, we are committed to providing you with the highest customer service. We will work closely with you to ensure you are comfortable and satisfied with your medical tattooing experience.

If you are considering getting a medical tattoo, contact us today to schedule a consultation. We will be happy to answer any questions you may have and help you plan your perfect tattoo.

Book Your procedure

Book Your procedure

What does medical tattooing cost?

  • Scar camouflage - 10cm x 10cm (60 minutes) R2 500
  • Scar camouflage - 20cm x 20cm (90 minutes) R5 000
  • Areola reconstruction (90 minutes) R4 500
  • Scalp micropigmentation (180 minutes) R8 500
Book Your procedure

Frequently asked questions about medical tattooing

What is medical tattooing?

Medical tattooing is a form of tattooing that uses sterile needles and pigments to fill in scars, restore colour to areas of the skin, or create the appearance of hair. The pigments used in medical tattooing are made from minerals and are safe for use on the skin.

How is medical tattooing done?

Medical tattooing is done using a sterile needle and ink. The needle is inserted into the skin and the ink is deposited into the scar or skin. The tattoo artist will then use a special tool to blend the ink into the scar or skin.

What are the benefits of medical tattooing?

There are many benefits of medical tattooing, including that it can help to improve the appearance of scars, restore colour to the skin after surgery or injury, and create the appearance of hair on the scalp.

Is medical tattooing safe?

Yes, medical tattooing is a safe and effective way to improve the appearance of hair, areoala, stretch marks or other areas to cover.

Are there any side effects of medical tattooing?

There are minimal side effects associated with medical tattooing, and these typically resolve within a few days. The most common side effects include temporary redness, swelling, and bruising at the site of the tattoo.

How long does medical tattooing last?

The results of medical tattooing are typically long-lasting, though they may fade over time. touch-ups may be necessary to maintain the results of the tattoo.

How much does medical tattooing cost?

The cost of medical tattooing will vary depending on the size and location of the tattoo, as well as the number of sessions required.

Is medical tattooing covered by insurance?

Medical tattooing may be covered by insurance if it is considered medically necessary. However, coverage will vary depending on the insurer.

What are the risks of medical tattooing?

The risks of medical tattooing are minimal, but as with any tattooing procedure, there is a small risk of infection. The risks can be further minimized by choosing a reputable tattoo artist and following aftercare instructions.

Where can I get medical tattooing?

Medical tattooing can be performed by a variety of healthcare providers, including dermatologists, plastic surgeons, and tattoo artists. At Blink Beauty Salon we offer medical tattooing as our aestheticians are highly qualified in this field.

Is tattoo removal possible after medical tattooing?

Yes, medical tattoo removal is possible. However, removing a medical tattoo may be more difficult than a traditional one. The type of ink used, as well as the depth of the tattoo, will affect the ability to remove the tattoo.
